author: Jacob Jarvis
title: More than half the votes in our Brexit 2.0 poll said we should remain in the EU - Leicestershire Live
text:
More than half the votes in our Brexit 2.0 poll said we should remain in the EU But most who commented seemed against another referendum Share Most voted REMAIN in our unofficial poll. (Image: Etienne Ansotte/EU/PA Wire) Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
The majority of votes in our unofficial Brexit poll backed Britain to remain in the EU if there were a second referendum.
On Monday, we published a poll asking what people would select at the stations if they were asked, right now, to pick between three options.
These were staying in the EU , leaving with no deal, or Prime Minister Theresa May's Chequers deal.
Leicestershire Live can now reveal the results of the poll, in which 2,381 votes were cast.
We can highlight that: 54 per cent of votes, 1,278, said to stay in the union Then 998, 42 per cent, said exit with no deal Four per cent, 105, were for the PM's Chequers deal Read More
After posting the story containing our questions, the comments section became fairly lively.
The majority of comments, in contrast to the answers provided, opposed the idea of another referendum.
One person wrote: "To reverse our democratic decision to leave and instead remain in the EU would be the very worst thing we could possibly do."
Another added: "We donâ€™t need another one. The result was to leave."
A major sticking point in the comments seemed not only what the result of a second vote would be, but what this would mean for democracy. Read More
